title: Domain 2.6: Given a scenario, configure a workstation to meet best practices for security.
content:
🛡️ Data-at-Rest Encryption

  • Purpose: Protects stored data even if the device is lost or stolen.
  • Tools: BitLocker (Windows), FileVault (macOS).

🔐 Password Best Practices

  • Complexity Requirements: Use 8–16+ character passwords with uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols.
  • Expiration Requirements: Set periodic expiration to reduce long-term risk.
  • BIOS/UEFI Passwords: Adds hardware-level protection against unauthorized booting or changes.

👤 End-User Best Practices

  • Screensaver Locks: Locks system after inactivity.
  • Log Off When Not in Use: Prevents session hijacking.
  • Protect Critical Hardware: Use locks or locked storage for devices like laptops.
  • Secure PII and Passwords: Don’t leave them visible or written — use password managers.

👥 Account Management

  • Restrict User Permissions: Follow least privilege principle.
  • Restrict Login Times: Limit access to work hours for added control.
  • Disable Guest Account: Avoids anonymous access.

⚙️ Additional Security Settings

  • Failed Attempts Lockout: Protects against brute-force login attempts.
  • Timeout/Screen Lock: Auto-locks system after inactivity.
  • Change Default Admin Account: Rename and secure default admin credentials.
  • Disable AutoRun/AutoPlay: Prevents malicious files from executing via USB or CDs.
